MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees who have completed mandatory security awareness training
Calculation: (Number of employees who completed training / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: Ensuring all employees complete security awareness training is critical for reducing human-related security risks.
Source: ENISA: Awareness Raising in Network and Information Security

MetricDescription:
Percentage of successful phishing attempts in awareness simulations
Calculation: (Number of employees who fell for phishing / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: Lower success rates in phishing simulations indicate better awareness among employees.
Source: NIST SP 800-50: Building an Information Technology Security Awareness and Training Program

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees who have acknowledged reading and understanding security policies
Calculation: (Number of acknowledgments / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: Ensuring employees acknowledge security policies helps in reinforcing their importance.
Source: ISO/IEC 27002: Code of practice for information security controls

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees who pass security awareness quizzes
Calculation: (Number of employees who passed / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: High pass rates indicate good understanding of security principles among employees.

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees who report security incidents
Calculation: (Number of incident reports / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: Encouraging incident reporting helps in early detection and mitigation of security issues.
Source: NIST SP 800-61: Computer Security Incident Handling Guide

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees reached by security awareness campaigns
Calculation: (Number of employees reached / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: Ensuring all employees are reached by awareness campaigns maximizes their effectiveness.
Source: ENISA: Awareness Raising in Network and Information Security

MetricDescription:
Percentage change in secure behaviors observed after awareness training
Calculation: ((Post-training secure behaviors - Pre-training secure behaviors) / Pre-training secure behaviors) * 100.
Comment: Measuring behavioral changes helps in assessing the effectiveness of awareness programs.
Source: ISO/IEC 27002: Code of practice for information security controls

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees complying with established security procedures
Calculation: (Number of employees complying / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: High compliance rates indicate strong adherence to security procedures.

MetricDescription:
Composite score measuring the overall security culture within the organization
Calculation: Aggregate score based on surveys, observations, and compliance rates.
Comment: A strong security culture is essential for sustainable security improvements.

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees actively engaging with security awareness content
Calculation: (Number of engaged employees / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: High engagement rates with awareness content indicate effective and relevant training materials.
Source: NIST SP 800-50: Building an Information Technology Security Awareness and Training Program

MetricDescription: % staff with significant security responsibilities who have received specialized training
Source: NIST (Archived): SP 800-55, Security Metrics Guide for Information Technology Systems
